hero.title: Building Safety Through Inclusive Design
hero.subtitle: Pleroma is a specialist consultancy delivering integrated fire safety engineering, accessibility design, and Universal Design solutions — helping organisations create environments that are safe, compliant, and inclusive for everyone.

story.label: Our Story
story.heading: A consultancy shaped by lived experience
story.p1: The vision behind Pleroma was inspired by the lived experience of a close family member of our founder, who became an expert in fire engineering. Witnessing firsthand the challenges people with disabilities face in fully participating in everyday life and during emergencies created a strong motivation to make a difference.
story.p2: In 2025, Pleroma was established as a consultancy providing fire safety engineering and accessibility design services. We deliver integrated design solutions that bring together fire engineering, Universal Design, accessibility, disability inclusion, and specialist training.
story.p3: Our goal is to create safer, more inclusive environments where everyone can navigate daily life and emergency situations with confidence.

embers.title: Flying Embers: The Unseen Threat That Could Burn Down Your Skyscraper
embers.p1: Flying embers, also known as firebrands, are one of the most underestimated threats in urban fire scenarios. Research consistently shows they are a major cause of secondary ignitions.
embers.p2: In dense urban environments, wind turbulence around tall buildings can lift embers hundreds of metres into the air and transport them across city blocks.
embers.p3: Balconies, rooftops, vents, façade systems, and architectural features become vulnerable landing zones where embers can accumulate unnoticed.
points: Unpredictable wind patterns around tall buildings
Multiple ignition points including vents and façades
Combustible balcony contents and façade materials
Increased exposure from urban–wildland interface fires
embers.p4: Fire safety codes are gradually addressing ember-related risks through non-combustible façades, ember-resistant vents, and improved compartmentation.
embers.p5: Continued research, advanced modelling, and proactive planning are essential as cities become taller and denser.

design.title: Design for All: Beyond the Ramp
design.p1: Accessible design is often treated as a compliance exercise, but inclusive design is a strategic approach that improves safety and usability for everyone.
design.p2: Designing for all enables people of all ages and abilities to navigate environments independently and with dignity.
design.p3: When accessibility is integrated early, it enhances architectural quality and long-term resilience.
design.p4: Designing for the edges rather than the average creates environments that work better for everyone.
